business.headline: Earning Rs 1 crore but can't afford a Rs 5 crore home in Gurgaon? Expert explains whyA Rs 1 crore annual salary sounds more than sufficient to buy a house. Yet, many high earners find themselves priced out of the housing market. Here's what an expert says about the real reasons behind this mismatch.

Holiday vs retirement home: How to decide the purpose of your second propertyMany buyers dream of a second home, but few pause to ask a key question: Is it meant for leisure or for life after work? The answer shapes everything from location and cost to comfort and long-term suitability. Let's have a look.
Sensex ends 545 points higher, Nifty above 26,100; RIL up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 545.52 points to end at 85,220.60, while the NSE Nifty50 added 190.75 points to close at 26,129.60​​​​​​​.

Vodafone Idea gets more time to pay Rs 87,695 crore AGR duesAccording to sources, the AGR dues amounting to Rs 87,695 crore will now be paid over a ten-year period from FY32 to FY41. While the decision eases near-term repayment pressure, it does not involve any waiver, haircut, or reduction in the total dues.

Did New Year's Eve strike by Swiggy, Zomato riders hit customers across India?With platforms heavily dependent on delivery partners during year-end celebrations, there was uncertainty over how widely the strike would be observed.

Last day to file revised ITR: Follow these simple steps for quick processingToday is the final day for taxpayers to submit a revised Income Tax Return. If you have spotted any mistake in your earlier filing, following a few simple steps can help you complete the process quickly and smoothly.

Silver prices crash after record rally. What should investors do now?Silver futures on MCX are trading sharply lower near Rs 2,37,000–2,38,000 per kg, after closing at Rs 2,32,723 in the previous session. The decline reflects the steep correction in global prices.

Why mid-career professionals feel financially stretched after switching jobsMid-career executives usually fall into the age group of 35 – 45 depending on the industry or job roles they occupy. By this time, they have their children studying in schools, financial commitments like home and vehicle loans and, in many cases, ageing parents to look after.

Gold at record high: Why Indians are choosing coins and ETFs over jewelleryGold prices in India have surged to historic highs in 2025, leading many consumers to shift from traditional jewellery purchases to coins, bars, and other investment forms.

Swiggy, Zomato raise delivery incentive amid New Year's Eve strike: ReportThe rise in incentives comes ahead of New Year's Eve, one of the busiest days for food delivery and online orders, when worker unions have called for fresh protests.

From Reliance Jio, PhonePe to Zepto: 5 key IPOs to watch in 2026India's IPO pipeline for 2026 is packed with some of the country's most talked-about companies. From established giants like Reliance Jio to fast-growing startups such as Zepto, several big listings are expected to keep investors busy.

How India overtook China to become the world's top rice producerIndia has emerged as the world's largest rice producer, but closing the yield gap and managing water stress will decide whether this production surge becomes a lasting advantage.

Hindustan copper share price tanks 3%: What's behind the fall?Copper prices have risen sharply this year due to supply disruptions at key global mines and strong demand from sectors such as electrification, renewable energy and artificial intelligence-led infrastructure.
Sensex opens 227 points higher, Nifty above 26,000; Tata Steel up 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 185.43 points to 84,860.51, while the NSE Nifty50 added 76.75 points to 26,015.60 as of 9:29 am.

Gold set for 50-year best, silver breaks records: Where should money go in 2026?After months of sharp gains, some investors are locking in profits, leading to short-term weakness in gold and silver. Even so, prices remain far higher than where they began the year.

Swiggy, Zomato, other gig delivery workers on New Year's Eve strike: Key demandsWorkers had already held a nationwide flash strike on December 25, which led to a 50–60% disruption in services in several cities.

Disney to pay $10m to settle children's privacy violations on YouTubeRegulators alleged that Disney failed to identify certain videos as being directed at children, despite the content being clearly child-focused. As a result, children were allegedly served targeted advertisements and had their personal information collected without proper notice to or consent from parents.

India imposes 3-year steel tariffs, targets cheap China importsIndia has imposed higher import duties on select steel products after trade regulators flagged a sharp rise in low-priced imports hurting domestic steelmakers.

India becomes 4th-largest economy by overtaking Japan, set to pip Germany by 2030India's real GDP grew 8.2 per cent in Q2 of 2025-26, driven by strong domestic consumption, urban demand, and structural reforms, the Centre said.

Why treating bonuses as permanent income can backfire on your financesMany people see bonuses as extra money and quickly adjust their spending or investments. But treating variable income as permanent can quietly strain finances and create stress later, even when salaries remain unchanged.

entertainment.headline: I had 103 degree fever: Harshaali Malhotra on Akhanda 2 shoot in Godavari amid rain Actor Haarshali Malhotra has spoken about the physical and emotional challenges faced while filming Akhanda 2. She highlighted her illness and the demanding river shoot during the monsoon season.

Kim Kardashian cries over failing bar exam, sister Khloe blames her TV show. Video American television personality, Kim Kardashian's video about failing in the California Bar Exams went viral. Her mother Kris Jenner, sister Khloe and son Saint can be seen consoling her in the viral clip.

Prithviraj Sukumaran to join Nani-Sujeeth's action comedy film: Report Reports suggest Malayalam actor Prithviraj Sukumaran is part of Nani and Sujeeth's upcoming film, reportedly titled Bloody Romeo.
Hrithik Roshan's goofy New Year post with Saba Azad comes with double-thumb joke Actor Hrithik Roshan posted a series of photos with Saba Azad, accompanied by a heartfelt New Year message.

What if Stranger Things season 5 revealed its biggest twist, and we missed it? Was Stranger Things Season 5 Episode 7 badly written, or deliberately unsettling? A deep dive into the twist about what is really happening in the episode.

Hrithik Roshan not in talks for Don 3 after Ranveer Singh's exit: Source India Today has exclusively learnt that Hrithik Roshan is not in talks for 'Don 3'. The reports of his casting emerged online after Ranveer Singh's sudden exit from the highly anticipated project.

Sant: 7-part series on Neem Karoli Baba, who inspired Julia Roberts, Steve Jobs A multilingual web series, tilted 'Sant' has been announced, which depicts the life of one of India's most revered saints, Neem Karoli Baba. Steve Jobs, Mark Zuckerberg and Julia Roberts are known to be his followers among popular public figures.

Dhurandhar meets MasterChef: Chef Vikas Khanna treats Ranveer, Deepika to modaks Actor-couple Ranveer Singh and Deepika Padukone marked the end of 2025 in New York by visiting chef Vikas Khanna's restaurant. Their visit comes shortly after fans shared positive accounts of meeting the couple during their holiday.

AR Rahman plays angry young director in Moon Walk, film to release in May Oscar-winning composer A R Rahman will make his first appearance as an actor in the upcoming film Moon Walk, directed by Manoj NS. The film, which also stars Prabhudheva, features Rahman in a fictional role and has generated anticipation with the release of multiple character posters.

Amitabh Bachchan's early New Year wish is a math problem, can you solve it? In a new post on X, Amitabh Bachchan rang in the New Year with a quirky twist. Instead of a regular greeting, the veteran actor shared a math puzzle, leaving fans busy decoding it in the comments section.

40-minute climax, zero AI shots: Director Maruthi breaks down The Raja Saab secrets After a mixed pre-release phase, The Raja Saab has seen renewed attention following the release of Trailer 2.0, with director Maruthi now addressing speculation around the film's visual effects.

One episode, too many loose ends. Can Stranger Things avoid a GoT-like finale? With one episode left, Stranger Things faces its toughest test yet. Can the finale fix Season 5 Volume 2's loose threads, save beloved characters, and avoid a Game of Thrones–level disappointment?

Tulsi vs Anupamaa to Ba***ds of Bollywood climax: What made news on TV, OTT in 2025 Smriti Irani's return as Tulsi revived primetime television and sparked a major TRP battle with Anupamaa. OTT platforms faced budget cuts but introduced fresh formats like micro-dramas, reshaping Indian entertainment.

Veteran Korean actor Ahn Sung Ki hospitalised after cardiac arrest Veteran South Korean actor Ahn Sung Ki is receiving intensive care after collapsing at his residence on December 30. His management agency has confirmed his critical condition and asked for privacy as he undergoes treatment.

Akshaye gave our dates to another film, left us stranded: Section 375 writer 'Section 375' writer Manish Gupta, in a new interview, has levied new allegations against Akshaye Khanna. He claimed that the actor took Rs 21 lakh advance after signing the film and gave dates to another film.

Bad Boy Billionaires India: Final episode on Satyam scandal releases after 5 years The much-awaited fourth episode of Bad Boy Billionaires: India, focusing on the Satyam Computer Services scandal, has been released on Netflix after a five-year legal battle, concluding the investigative series.

Chappell Roan backtracks on Brigitte Bardot praise after knowing of far-right views Singer Chappell Roan has retracted her public praise of Brigitte Bardot after learning of the late French actor's far-right political views and history of convictions for inciting racial hatred.

Deepika Padukone lives pop dream at Backstreet Boys' concert with best friend Deepika Padukone attended a Backstreet Boys concert in Las Vegas with her friend Sneha Ramchander as part of her New Year celebrations. She and husband Ranveer Singh are spending time with their family in the United States.

Bharti Singh debunks AI images of newborn son Kaju, confirms face not revealed Comedian Bharti Singh has clarified that recent images of her son Kaju, circulating on social media, are not authentic. Bharti and her husband, Haarsh Limbachiyaa, are yet to reveal their son's face publicly.

general news.headline: Pakistan will be busy in 2026 repairing airbases India struck. What's the status?Over seven months have passed since India struck 11 key Pakistani airbases during Operation Sindoor. After digging through satellite imagery and collating inputs from intelligence sources, we have found that Pakistan is still working to fix the damage. Here is a status check.

Packed with pig poop goodness: People mock Bangladesh on US corn importsPig manure is commonly used as a fertiliser in corn cultivation in the United States. The issue has gained traction and generated buzz because Bangladesh is a Muslim-majority country, where the use and consumption of pork-related products are considered haram.

Setback for H-1B visa fee fight as Obama-appointed judge calls US govt move legalA US District Court has ruled that the high fee on new H-1B visas imposed by the Trump administration is legal. The petitioner, the US Chamber of Commerce, has now filed a plea with the US Appeals court. It was an Obama-appointed judge who ruled in favour of the high H-1B visa fee.

Biocon employee, 26, jumps to death from 5th floor of Bengaluru office buildingA 26-year-old employee of Biocon Biologics allegedly died by suicide after jumping from the fifth floor of his office building in Bengaluru on Tuesday, police said.
World begins ringing in New Year as New Zealand welcomes 2026 with fireworksWorld begins ringing in New Year as New Zealand welcomes 2026 with spectacular fireworks display in Auckland

Live: Khaleda Zia laid to rest; Jaishankar hands PM's letter to Tarique RahmanKhaleda Zia Last Rites Live Updates: The former Prime Minister of Bangladesh and the supremo of the Bangladesh Nationalist Party, Khaleda Zia, was buried beside her husband's grave on Wednesday. Her funeral was attended by several foreign dignitaries, including India's Foreign Minister, S Jaishankar, who met Zia's son Tarique Rahman and handed him Prime Minister Narendra Modi's letter of condolences. Her death has triggered nationwide mourning and wide international reactions. As tributes pour in from political leaders in Bangladesh, India and beyond, her life story has also drawn attention to her roots in Jalpaiguri, West Bengal, and her family's migration to East Pakistan after Partition. Zia, a dominant figure in Bangladesh's politics and the country's first woman prime minister, is remembered as a resilient leader who shaped the nation's democratic journey amid prolonged political struggle.

Peanuts, Doordarshan and gajar ka halwa: A 90s New Year we didn't know was specialHandcrafted ByOur Editors New Year's Eve in 90s India was a quiet celebration centred around Doordarshan and homemade snacks. This nostalgic tradition highlights simpler times before digital distractions and lavish parties.

Did New Year's Eve strike by Swiggy, Zomato riders hit customers across India?With platforms heavily dependent on delivery partners during year-end celebrations, there was uncertainty over how widely the strike would be observed.

Tulsi vs Anupamaa to Ba***ds of Bollywood climax: What made news on TV, OTT in 2025Smriti Irani's return as Tulsi revived primetime television and sparked a major TRP battle with Anupamaa. OTT platforms faced budget cuts but introduced fresh formats like micro-dramas, reshaping Indian entertainment.

150 kg ammonium nitrate, explosive cartridges seized from car in RajasthanPolice said 150 Kg of Ammonium Nitrate was found hidden in the sacks of urea fertilizer. Around 200 dangerous explosive cartridges and 6 bundles of safety fuse wire totaling approximately 1100 meters were also recovered during the police operation.

Do I shoot you? Bangladesh Hindu man's colleague asked before killing himThe colleague who killed a Bangladeshi Hindu man asked him, "Do I shoot you," before ending up killing him. Bajendra Biswas, who was shot dead in a Bangladesh garment factory, might have died due to a prank by his Ansar Bahini colleague Noman Mia. Witnesses allege there was little ill will between the two, and the police are trying to determine the root cause of the death.

When Khaleda Zia was locked away alone in Bangladesh's largest jail for two yearsCut off from BNP colleagues, family and the public eye, three-time Bangladeshi PM Khaleda Zia was imprisoned in near-total isolation inside the country's biggest prison, Dhaka Central Jail, for two years. The jail term, which began in February 2018, was widely seen as a political message of how far the Sheikh Hasina government was willing to go to break her most formidable rival.

These are our favourite sporting moments of 2025. What is yours?Records fell, waits ended and futures arrived early in 2025, a year when sport refused to slow down, and left us all with moments worth arguing about long after the final whistle. Which moment gave you goosebumps, joy or disbelief? Tell us the one you'll never forget.

Find everything your baby needs this holiday season on Amazon's Everyday EssentialsAs part of the New Year selections, the specially curated New Year Store —available until 31 December 2025—brings up to 50% off across a wide selection of everyday essentials.

Vodafone Idea gets more time to pay Rs 87,695 crore AGR duesAccording to sources, the AGR dues amounting to Rs 87,695 crore will now be paid over a ten-year period from FY32 to FY41. While the decision eases near-term repayment pressure, it does not involve any waiver, haircut, or reduction in the total dues.

Natti chicken feast planned as Siddaramaiah closes in on record Karnataka CM tenureWith a week to go, Siddaramaiah is poised to break Devaraj Urs's record and cement his legacy as Karnataka's longest-serving chief minister.

What if Stranger Things season 5 revealed its biggest twist, and we missed it?Was Stranger Things Season 5 Episode 7 badly written, or deliberately unsettling? A deep dive into the twist about what is really happening in the episode.

Contaminated water kills 7 in Indore, 2 civic body officials suspendedWhile the water sample test reports are awaited, the Indore Mayor pointed out that at first glance it appeared that drainage water might have gotten mixed with drinking water supply lines, contaminating the water.
Sensex ends 545 points higher, Nifty above 26,100; RIL up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 545.52 points to end at 85,220.60, while the NSE Nifty50 added 190.75 points to close at 26,129.60​​​​​​​.

No third party: India's firm reply as China joins Trump in Pak truce credit warIndia has consistently maintained that the ceasefire on May 10, following Operation Sindoor, was reached following direct talks between New Delhi and Islamabad.

Women feel betrayed, desert Bangladesh's NCP. Did they ignore Jamaat DNA?Handcrafted ByOur Editors Several prominent women leaders of the NCP, the Bangladesh students' party backing the Muhammad Yunus-led interim set-up, have either spoken against the outfit or resigned in the last one week. Behind the anger is the NCP's alliance with the radical Jamaat-e-Islami. Did they overlook the Jamaat DNA?
India bans high-dose nimesulide: Health risks behind the decisionA widely used painkiller faces fresh curbs as safety concerns resurface.

Woman offered lift, raped for hours in moving van, dumped on roadside in FaridabadA woman in Faridabad faced a horrific ordeal when she was allegedly raped inside a moving van after accepting a late-night lift. Police have registered a case and are actively searching for the accused.

How a 1958 Soviet agreement built India's second IITThe Soviet Union, during the Cold War era, played a significant role in the creation of India's second IIT, which is currently ranked as the country's best IIT in the QS rankings. The agreement was signed at a time when India was still finding its footing, academic institutions were few, and the drive to learn and build capacity was strong.

sports.headline: Vaishnavi Sharma spills the secret behind special celebration with Harmanpreet Kaur Vaishnavi Sharma revealed that her choreographed wicket celebration with Harmanpreet Kaur in the fourth Women's T20I was a pre-planned team-huddle idea, capping an impressive series in which she emerged as a joint-highest wicket-taker.

Inspired by icons: Jerrssis Wadia draws lessons from Virat Kohli, Yuvraj Singh Australian youngster Jerrssis Wadia, inspired by Yuvraj Singh's comeback and shaped by lessons from Virat Kohli and Travis Head, has announced himself in BBL 2025–26 for the Adelaide Strikers.

Bumrah's No.1 Test rank under threat from Australia pacer, Pakistan spinner Jasprit Bumrah's spot at the top of the ICC Test rankings for bowlers continues to remain under threat with Mitchell Starc and Noman Ali breathing down the neck of the Indian pacer.

Gulbadin, Naveen return as Afghanistan name Rashid Khan-led T20 World Cup squad Rashid Khan will lead Afghanistan in the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2026, to be staged in India and Sri Lanka. The Afghanistan Cricket Board confirmed the leg-spinner as captain while announcing a 15-member squad for the marquee tournament.

Not a Test specialist any more. Sarfaraz Khan smashes 75-ball 157 after IPL contract Vijay Hazare Trophy: Sarfaraz Khan smashed a 75-ball 157 for Mumbai, steering them to a mammoth total of 444 in Jaipur on Wednesday. Sarfaraz has been in fine form in white-ball domestic circuit.

Cristiano Ronaldo hits 'cringe' SIU, fans calls out shameless celebration Legendary Cristiano Ronaldo was heavily criticised by football fans after wildly celebrating one of his goals in the Saudi Pro League. Many called him selfish, stating that Ronaldo is only motivated to score 1000 career goals and does not care about his team and teammates.

Gaikwad warms up for New Zealand series with splendid century in Vijay Hazare Ruturaj Gaikwad scored a magnificent 124 to help Maharashtra post 331 against Uttarakhand in the Vijay Hazare Trophy. He will next feature in India's ODI series against New Zealand starting January 11.

Padikkal knocks on India ODI selection door with 3rd hundred in four matches Karnataka batter Devdutt Padikkal kept his India ODI ambitions firmly alive with his third century in four matches in the ongoing Vijay Hazare Trophy. The left-hander continued his prolific run by reaching three figures once again, this time against Puducherry at the ADSA Railways Cricket Ground in Ahmedabad.

England to win next Ashes in Australia: Former cricketer makes bizarre prediction Former England cricketer Phil Tufnell has made a bold prediction regarding England's Ashes prospects in Australia. The former spinner has backed the English side to end their Ashes series victory down under in their next series in the country.

Cricket fraternity rallies around Damien Martyn as serious illness leaves him in coma Adam Gilchrist, R Ashwin and VVS Laxman were among the cricketers who sent messages of support to Damien Martyn after the former Australia batter was hospitalised with meningitis. Messages from across the cricketing world followed as former teammates, opponents, and current players wished Martyn strength and a speedy recovery while he remains under medical care.

These are our favourite sporting moments of 2025. What is yours? Records fell, waits ended and futures arrived early in 2025, a year when sport refused to slow down, and left us all with moments worth arguing about long after the final whistle. Which moment gave you goosebumps, joy or disbelief? Tell us the one you'll never forget.

After World Cup snub, Gill to play Vijay Hazare Trophy in January: ReportShubman Gill, Ravindra Jadeja and KL Rahul will play in the Vijay Hazare Trophy in January. The trio will leave their respective teams ahead of the three-match ODI series against New Zealand, beginning on January 11.

Arsenal end 2025 on top, Man United stumble against bottom-placed WolvesPremier League 2025-26: Arsenal delivered a commanding 4-1 win against Aston Villa to end 2025 at the top of the table. Meanwhile, Manchester United struggled to a 1-1 draw with bottom-placed Wolves on Tuesday night.

Ashes hero Travis Head makes crucial BBL call ahead of T20 World CupTravis Head, who has played a key role in Australia's Ashes dominance, is likely to sit out of the Big Bash League season. The left-handed opener said he is focussing on remaining fresh for T20 World Cup, starting February 7 in India and Sri Lanka.

Damien Martyn in induced coma, battling for life against MeningitisFormer Australian cricketer Damien Martyn is in an induced coma fighting meningitis. His condition has drawn widespread concern and prayers from the cricket community across Australia.

Indian sports in 2025: Handshake rows, stampedes and controversies that shaped the yearFrom league uncertainty and safety scares to stampedes, political snubs and war halting the IPL, Indian sport in 2025 was defined by chaos, controversy and failures that overshadowed competition.

Carlsen now a 20-time world champion, ends 2025 with Rapid and Blitz doubleMagnus Carlsen extended his dominance by winning a record ninth World Blitz title along with the Rapid gold medal in Doha. Carlsen defeated Uzbek GM Nodirbek Abdusattorov after producing a stunning, unexpected pawn move in the fourth game of the clash to seal a 2.5–1.5 victory.

Margins to mainstream: India women's cricket team wins Battle of the Sexes in 20252025 was the year Indian women's cricket earned the respect it deserved, with India lifting their maiden ICC title — the ODI World Cup. The challenge for India in the coming year will be to maintain that consistency and, perhaps, add a T20 World Cup title at Lord's to their growing legacy.

Jemimah selfie, debutants lifting trophy: India sign off in style after Sri Lanka sweepJemimah Rodrigues took her signature selfie and the debutants Kamalini and Vaishanavi Sharma lifted the trophy for the side as India celebrated their 5-0 series win over Sri Lanka in style on Tuesday, December 30.

Carlsen reaches World blitz C'ships final after turnaround, Erigaisi gets bronzeArjun Erigaisi's remarkable World Blitz campaign ended with a semifinal loss to Nodirbek Abdusattorov, earning the Indian Grandmaster a historic double bronze. Magnus Carlsen set up a final showdown with Abdusattorov after overcoming Fabiano Caruana.

5th WT20I: India thump Sri Lanka to complete 5-0 clean sweep, ends 2025 with a bangWith the final game of the series, Sri Lanka finally decided to wake up and put up their best performance in the series. But India proved to be too good for them as they went on to take the win by XX runs to complete the 5-0 series whitewash in Thiruvananthapuram on Tuesday, December 30.

BBL: Taxi breaks down, Perth Scorchers players arrive at stadium by pushing UberBBL: Hilarious scenes unfolded on Tuesday after some of the Perth Scorchers players got stuck on their way to the stadium. While travelling to the stadium, their Uber broke down, but they managed to revive the situation.

Watch: Glenn Phillips turns left hander, stuns fans with mega sixesNew Zealand batter Glenn Phillips stunned the crowd by turning into a left-hander. Playing in the Super Smash, Phillips slam-banged his way to an unbeaten 90 runs off just 48 balls.

How Usman Khawaja should retire after 5th Ashes Test? Ex-Australia captain reveals planMichael Clarke has tipped Usman Khawaja to retire from cricket after the SCG Test. Clarke is hoping that Khawaja can sign off on a high by scoring a hundred in front of his home crowd in Sydney.

India vs Sri Lanka 5th WT20I: Ball-by-ball commentary from TrivandrumIndia vs Sri Lanka 5th WT20I Ball-by-ball commentary from Trivandrum: With the series wrapped, India will look to wrap things up and complete a clean sweep of Sri Lanka in Trivandrum. The visitors are aiming to salvage some pride in what is expected to be a thrilling contest.

Watch: Magnus loses cool again, board fumble leads to defeat at World Blitz C'shipMagnus Carlsen suffered a bizarre loss at the World Blitz Championship after fumbling his pieces with seconds left, leading to defeat against Haik Martirosyan in Doha.

IND vs SL: Smriti Mandhana rested for final T20I, India hand G Kamalini debutIndia have decided to rest Smriti Mandhana for the final T20I of the series against Sri Lanka. They have handed the young prodigy G Kamalini her debut for the match in Trivandrum.

Lasith Malinga joins Sri Lanka's coaching staff ahead of T20 World Cup 2026Lasith Malinga has been appointed Sri Lanka's fast-bowling consultant as part of their preparations for the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2026, bringing vast white-ball and coaching experience to the setup.

5th Women's T20I Highlights: India complete 5-0 sweep with 15-run winIndia Women vs Sri Lanka Women Highlights: A commanding performance from the bowlers and a brilliant fifty from Harmanpreet Kaur was enough as India complete the 5-0 sweep over Sri Lanka to head into the new year with a big win.

Suryakumar Yadav used to message me a lot: Actor makes explosive claimActor Khushi Mukherjee has gone viral on social media after making a bombshell claim involving the India T20I captain. Mukherjee has claimed that Suryakumar Yadav used to message her frequently in the past. However, she has denied any romantic involvement with a cricketer.

T20 World Cup 2026: Oman name Jatinder Singh as captain, leave out veteran KaleemOman's most experienced player, Jatinder Singh, will captain the national team at the 2026 ICC Men's T20 World Cup after missing the previous edition. The squad features five changes from the Asia Cup, with veteran Aamir Kaleem omitted despite recent strong performances.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
